name: kubectl
summary: kubectl is the command-line tool for interacting with Kubernetes clusters. It allows users to deploy applications, inspect resources, manage deployments, and access cluster services.

steps.detail: echo "deb [signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/kubernetes-archive-keyring.gpg] https://apt.kubernetes.io/ kubernetes-xenial main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/kubernetes.list
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y kubectl

notes: Lists all nodes in the cluster

stages.label: Prepare manifest
stages.command:
cat > deployment.yaml << EOF
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: myapp
spec:
  replicas: 3
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: myapp
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: myapp
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: myapp
        image: myapp:latest
EOF

name: Falco
summary: Falco is a runtime security tool that uses system calls to detect unexpected application behavior and security issues. It provides real-time alerting for suspicious activities in containers and Kubernetes.

steps.detail: echo "deb https://download.falco.org/packages/deb stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/falcosecurity.list
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install -y falco

stages.label: Deploy Falco
stages.command: sudo systemctl start falco && sudo systemctl enable falco

advanced_usage.title: Custom detection rules
advanced_usage.command:
sudo cat > /etc/falco/custom-rules.yaml << EOF
- rule: Detect Unauthorized Shell Access
  desc: Unauthorized shell access detected
  condition: spawned_process and proc.name in (sh, bash) and container
  output: Unauthorized shell (user=%user.name command=%proc.cmdline)
  priority: WARNING
EOF
